com.googlecode.sarasvati

Interface TokenSet

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibTokenSet, MemTokenSet

    public interface TokenSet
    A token set is way of associating tokens together and allowing them to have state relative to one another. This takes two forms:
    • Each token has an index in the token set. This allows a token in the set to be distinguished from other (useful for template style nodes).
    • The token set has it's own environment. The token set environment may contain attributes visible to all tokens in the set, or just tokens with a specific index.
    Author:
    Paul Lorenz

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<ArcToken> getActiveArcTokens(Engine engine)
      Returns the list of active (non-completed) arc tokens which are members of this token set.
      Collection<NodeToken> getActiveNodeTokens(Engine engine)
      Returns the list of active (non-completed) node tokens which are members of this token set.
      Env getEnv()
      A token set provides an environment into which attributes can be stored.
      int getLevel()
      Returns the level of the token set.
      int getMaxMemberIndex()
      Returns the maximum member index that a member of this token set may have.
      TokenSetMemberEnv getMemberEnv()
      In addition to provide an environment which is shared across all members of the token set (see getEnv()), the token set also provides an environment which allows setting attributes per member index.
      String getName()
      Returns the name given to this token set.
      GraphProcess getProcess()
      Returns the process that this token set belongs to.

      • getActiveArcTokens

        Collection<ArcToken> getActiveArcTokens(Engine engine)
        Returns the list of active (non-completed) arc tokens which are members of this token set.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine executing the current process. May be required in order to load the token list.
        Returns:
        the collection of active (non-completed) arc tokens which are members of this token set.

      • getActiveNodeTokens

        Collection<NodeToken> getActiveNodeTokens(Engine engine)
        Returns the list of active (non-completed) node tokens which are members of this token set.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine executing the current process. May be required in order to load the token list.
        Returns:
        the list of active (non-completed) node tokens which are members of this token set.

      • getMaxMemberIndex

        int getMaxMemberIndex()
        Returns the maximum member index that a member of this token set may have.
        Returns:
        the maximum member index that a member of this token set may have

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Returns the level of the token set. A token set in isolation will have a level of 1. A token set created inside another token set (or sets) will have level of 1 greater than maximum level of the containing token sets.
        Returns:
        The token set level.

      • getEnv

        Env getEnv()
        A token set provides an environment into which attributes can be stored. This environment is shared across all tokens which are members of the environment.
        Returns:
        The token set environment

      • getMemberEnv

        TokenSetMemberEnv getMemberEnv()
        In addition to provide an environment which is shared across all members of the token set (see getEnv()), the token set also provides an environment which allows setting attributes per member index.

        The member environment also allows setting attributes per index via list.

        Returns:
        The token set member environment.
